com.google.android.exoplayer.upstream

Interface Allocation


  • public interface Allocation
    An Allocation, defined to consist of a set of fragments of underlying byte arrays.

    The byte arrays in which the fragments are located are obtained by getBuffers(). For each, the offset and length of the fragment within the byte array are obtained using getFragmentOffset(int) and getFragmentLength(int) respectively.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int capacity()
      Gets the capacity of the allocation, in bytes.
      void ensureCapacity(int size)
      Ensures the allocation has a capacity greater than or equal to the specified size in bytes.
      byte[][] getBuffers()
      Gets the buffers in which the fragments are allocated.
      int getFragmentLength(int index)
      The length of the fragment in the buffer at the specified index.
      int getFragmentOffset(int index)
      The offset of the fragment in the buffer at the specified index.
      void release()
      Releases the allocation.

    • Method Detail

      • ensureCapacity

        void ensureCapacity(int size)
        Ensures the allocation has a capacity greater than or equal to the specified size in bytes.

        If size is greater than the current capacity of the allocation, then it will grow to have a capacity of at least size. The allocation is grown by adding new fragments. Existing fragments remain unchanged, and any data that has been written to them will be preserved.

        If size is less than or equal to the capacity of the allocation, then the call is a no-op.

        Parameters:
        size - The minimum required capacity, in bytes.

      • capacity

        int capacity()
        Gets the capacity of the allocation, in bytes.
        Returns:
        The capacity of the allocation, in bytes.

      • getBuffers

        byte[][] getBuffers()
        Gets the buffers in which the fragments are allocated.
        Returns:
        The buffers in which the fragments are allocated.

      • getFragmentOffset

        int getFragmentOffset(int index)
        The offset of the fragment in the buffer at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the buffer.
        Returns:
        The offset of the fragment in the buffer.

      • getFragmentLength

        int getFragmentLength(int index)
        The length of the fragment in the buffer at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the buffer.
        Returns:
        The length of the fragment in the buffer.

      • release

        void release()
        Releases the allocation.
